nano.remexp.broadcaster
Class RemoteExperimentBroadcaster

java.lang.Object
  nano.remexp.broadcaster.RemoteExperimentBroadcaster
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventSocketListener, StreamSocketInterface, StreamReceiver
public class RemoteExperimentBroadcaster
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventSocketListener, StreamSocketInterface, StreamReceiver

This is the main class to be started. It is a command and stream broadcaster between the remote experiments server and the clients. It funnels the commands and allows only a defined set to be passed. It implements locking mechanisms during execution of certain commands.

Version:
1.1 23.08.2012
Author:
Dominic Bosch

initLogger

protected void initLogger(java.lang.String logFileExt,
                          int dbgMode)
Sets the debug mode and log file name if necessary.

Parameters:
logFileExt - the extension of the log file
dbgMode - the debug mode, see @see Debg class for more information about debug modes.

initRemExpPorts

protected void initRemExpPorts(int eventPort,
                               int streamPort)
This function handles the initialization of the ports for the remote experiment.

Parameters:
eventPort - the event port on which this server listens for the connecting experiment server.
streamPort - the stream port on which this server listens for connecting experiment server.

initClientPorts

protected void initClientPorts(int eventPort,
                               int streamPort)
This function handles the initialization of the client ports according to their definition in the config file. It also instantiates the @see FilteringPool object that handles the communication inbounding from the clients.

Parameters:
eventPort - the event port on which the server listens for connecting clients
streamPort - the stream port on which the server listens for connecting clients

addRig

protected void addRig(java.lang.String rigname)
Passes the Rig name to the pool for registration.

Parameters:
rigname - the Rig name to be registered.

setRemExpName

protected void setRemExpName(java.lang.String name)
Registers the name of the connected remote experiment.

Parameters:
name - the name of the remote experiment

addUser

protected void addUser(java.lang.String uname,
                       java.lang.String pw,
                       java.lang.String priv)
Looks in the NanoComm class for an appropriate privilege field and registers the credentials in the pool if the input is valid.

Parameters:
uname - the credential's user name
pw - the credential's password
priv - the privileges that are gained by logging in with these credentials

addSample

protected void addSample(java.lang.String nm,
                         java.lang.String cmd,
                         java.lang.String rel,
                         java.lang.String x,
                         java.lang.String y,
                         java.lang.String dx,
                         java.lang.String dy)
Passes sample parameters to the pool for registration if they are valid.

Parameters:
nm - the name of the sample
cmd - the command to make the stage mov to the sample
rel - the command sent by the remote experiment, indicating the movement to the sample succeeded
x - the initial x position of the tip at this sample
y - the initial y position of the tip at this sample
dx - the maximum distance allowed away from the initial tip position in x direction
dy - the maximum distance allowed away from the initial tip position in y direction

addRemExpHost

protected void addRemExpHost(java.lang.String host)
This method adds a host to the internal list of allowed hosts for the remote experiment. This means only they are allowed to connect as remote experiment to the remote experiments broadcaster.

Parameters:
host - A host that is allowed to connect as remote experiment

setRemExpSocket

protected void setRemExpSocket(java.net.Socket sock,
                               int port)
This method is used to set the event and stream sockets as soon as they are connected.

Parameters:
sock - The socket that has been connected.
port - The port identifying either the stream or event socket.

finishedInitialization

protected void finishedInitialization()
Sets the flag that indicates all data has been loaded from the xml configuration file.

performSocketEvent

public void performSocketEvent(EventSocket sock,
                               java.lang.String message)
Remote experiment sends event thus this has to be processed and delivered further.

Specified by:
performSocketEvent in interface EventSocketListener
Parameters:
message - The message that has been received from the remote experiment.
sock - The socket on which the event has been detected.

isRemExpConnected

protected boolean isRemExpConnected()
This function answers the question whether the remote experiments event socket is connected or not.

Returns:
True if the remote experiments event socket is connected, else false.

sendToRemExp

protected void sendToRemExp(java.lang.String message)
This function sends events directly to the remote experiment.

Parameters:
message - the message to be sent through the socket

write

public void write(byte[] b)
This function is called when the remote experiment sends data through the stream socket. The data is then shoved into the pipe.

Specified by:
write in interface StreamReceiver
Parameters:
b - The byte array to be sent through the pipe.

This method removes the event socket to the remote experiment.

Specified by:
removeEventSocket in interface EventSocketListener
Parameters:
sock - The socket to be removed.

removeStreamSocket

public void removeStreamSocket(StreamSocket sock)
This method removes the stream socket to the remote experiment.

Specified by:
removeStreamSocket in interface StreamSocketInterface
Parameters:
sock - the stream socket that is removed

login

public void login(EventSocket sock,
                  java.lang.String user,
                  java.lang.String pass)
Not used for remote experiment socket.

Specified by:
login in interface EventSocketListener
Parameters:
sock - The socket that tries to gain privileges.
user - The username used to gain privileges.
pass - The password passed as a MD-5 hash in case of a non-LiLa login, empty if LiLa login shall be attempted.

reconnectToRemExp

protected void reconnectToRemExp()
This function removes the link to the remote experiment and thus initializes reconnection.

restartCBR

protected void restartCBR()
Shuts down the remote experiment broadcaster and then starts a new instance.

shutDownCBR

protected void shutDownCBR()
Shuts down everything on the remote experiment broadcaster.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The main method to start the Remote experiments broadcaster that is placed between a remote experiments server and the clients as a filtering and locking instance.

Parameters:
args - no arguments are required to start the server. Only the file config.xml in the folder conf must be present. This file needs to contain the information according to the document type definition in the file config.dtd.
